name: Delhi
description: Delhi, India's vibrant capital, is a world within itself. With its kaleidoscope of scents, sounds, and sights, Delhi never fails to captivate. From its rich history and architectural marvels to its delectable cuisine and vibrant nightlife, the city offers an unforgettable experience.

name: Amritsar
description: Explore the Golden Temple, a spiritual hub for Sikhs, and experience the Wagah Border ceremony.

name: Auli
description: A paradise for skiing enthusiasts with breathtaking views of the Himalayan peaks.

name: Alleppey
description: Famous for its backwaters and houseboat cruises, offering a unique experience of Kerala.

name: Bikaner
description: Explore the grand Junagarh Fort and taste the famous Bikaneri Bhujia.

name: Chattisgarh
description: Home to stunning waterfalls and tribal culture, a hidden gem in India.

name: Corbett National Park
description: India?s oldest national park, famous for Bengal tigers and diverse wildlife.

name: Chittorgarh
description: Famous for its massive fort and Rajputana history.

name: Goa
description: India?s party capital, known for its beaches, nightlife, and Portuguese heritage.

name: Jaisalmer
description: The "Golden City" of Rajasthan, known for its sand dunes and fort.

name: Jodhpur
description: Known as the "Blue City," Jodhpur is famous for its stunning blue-painted houses and the majestic Mehrangarh Fort.

name: Jaipur
description: The capital city of Rajasthan, Jaipur is known for its rich history, pink-hued architecture, and vibrant culture.

name: Katra
description: Katra serves as the base camp for the holy pilgrimage to Vaishno Devi, nestled in the Trikuta Mountains.

name: Kolkata
description: The cultural capital of India, Kolkata is known for its colonial architecture, art galleries, and delicious street food.

name: Kochi
description: A coastal city known for its beautiful backwaters, colonial history, and rich spice trade heritage.

name: Khajjiar
description: Often referred to as the "Mini Switzerland of India," Khajjiar is famous for its meadows and stunning landscapes.

name: Khajuraho
description: Renowned for its stunning temples adorned with intricate erotic sculptures, Khajuraho is a UNESCO World Heritage site.

name: Kalimpong
description: A serene hill station known for its beautiful monasteries and stunning views of the Himalayas.

name: Kullu Manali
description: A breathtaking hill station known for its snow-capped peaks, adventure sports, and serene landscapes.

name: Lakshadweep
description: A tropical paradise with pristine beaches, crystal-clear waters, and vibrant marine life.

name: Leh
description: A high-altitude desert town, famous for its monasteries, scenic landscapes, and adventure activities.

name: Kovalam
description: A coastal town in Kerala known for its beautiful crescent-shaped beaches and Ayurveda treatments.

name: Mahabalipuram
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site, famous for its ancient rock-cut temples and shore temples.

name: Mandawa
description: A small town in Rajasthan, famous for its grand havelis and fresco paintings.

name: Madurai
description: One of the oldest cities in India, known for the iconic Meenakshi Temple and rich cultural heritage.

name: Mumbai
description: The city of dreams, known for Bollywood, Marine Drive, Gateway of India, and its vibrant nightlife.

name: Munnar
description: A beautiful hill station in Kerala, famous for its tea plantations, misty hills, and waterfalls.

name: Marari
description: A serene beach in Kerala, known for its golden sands, swaying palms, and peaceful environment.

name: Orchha
description: A historic town in Madhya Pradesh, known for its grand palaces, temples, and cenotaphs.

name: Pune
description: A cultural and educational hub of Maharashtra, known for its historic forts and vibrant city life.

name: Nubra Valley
description: A breathtaking valley in Ladakh, known for its sand dunes, monasteries, and double-humped camels.

name: Pangong Tso
description: A mesmerizing high-altitude lake in Ladakh, famous for its ever-changing shades of blue.

name: Periyar
description: A famous wildlife sanctuary in Kerala, home to elephants, tigers, and scenic boat rides.

name: Pelling
description: A charming town in Sikkim, offering spectacular views of Kanchenjunga and ancient monasteries.

name: Rameswaram
description: A sacred town in Tamil Nadu, home to the famous Ramanathaswamy Temple and pristine beaches.

name: Srinagar
description: The summer capital of Jammu and Kashmir, known for Dal Lake, houseboats, and Mughal gardens.

name: Ranthambore National Park
description: A wildlife sanctuary in Rajasthan, famous for its majestic Bengal tigers and historic fort.

name: Udaipur
description: The City of Lakes, known for its royal palaces, scenic lakes, and rich heritage.

name: Varanasi
description: One of the oldest living cities in the world, famous for its ghats, temples, and spiritual essence.

name: Thanjavur
description: A historic city in Tamil Nadu, renowned for the Brihadeeswarar Temple, classical art, and rich heritage.

name: Chandigarh
description: Beautiful city and union territory serving as the capital of Punjab and Haryana.

name: Delhi
description: The capital of India, known for its historical monuments and vibrant culture.

name: Haryana
description: A state in North India known for its rich agricultural land and heritage.

name: Himachal Pradesh
description: Famous for its scenic mountains and adventure tourism.

name: Jammu and Kashmir
description: Known for its stunning landscapes, valleys, and cultural heritage.

name: Ladakh
description: A cold desert region famous for its monasteries and breathtaking views.

name: Punjab
description: Known for its vibrant culture, Golden Temple, and delicious cuisine.

name: Rajasthan
description: Famous for its desert landscapes, palaces, and historical forts.

name: Uttar Pradesh
description: Home to the Taj Mahal, Varanasi, and a rich historical legacy.

name: Uttarakhand
description: Known for its spiritual sites and Himalayan beauty.

name: Arunachal Pradesh
description: A state in Northeast India with rich tribal culture and natural beauty.

name: Assam
description: Famous for its tea gardens and Kaziranga National Park.

name: Manipur
description: Known for its scenic landscapes and Loktak Lake.

name: Meghalaya
description: Famous for its living root bridges and beautiful waterfalls.

name: Mizoram
description: A hilly state with rich tribal traditions and scenic beauty.

name: Nagaland
description: Famous for its indigenous Naga tribes and Hornbill Festival.

name: Sikkim
description: A picturesque state with stunning views of the Himalayas.

name: Tripura
description: Known for its temples, palaces, and scenic beauty.

name: Andaman and Nicobar Islands
description: A tropical paradise known for its pristine beaches and marine life.

name: Bihar
description: Home to ancient Buddhist sites and historical heritage.

name: Jharkhand
description: A state rich in mineral resources and natural beauty.

name: Odisha
description: Famous for its temples, beaches, and rich cultural heritage.

name: West Bengal
description: Known for its diverse culture, Kolkata, and the Sundarbans.

name: Chhattisgarh
description: A state known for its waterfalls and tribal culture.

name: Madhya Pradesh
description: Home to wildlife sanctuaries and ancient temples.

name: Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu
description: Union territory with beautiful coastal views.

name: Goa
description: Famous for its beaches, nightlife, and Portuguese heritage.

name: Gujarat
description: Known for the Gir National Park and Rann of Kutch.

name: Maharashtra
description: Home to Mumbai, Bollywood, and the Ajanta-Ellora caves.

name: Andhra Pradesh
description: Famous for its temples and coastal beauty.

name: Karnataka
description: Known for Bengaluru, historical sites, and hill stations.

name: Kerala
description: Popular for its backwaters, beaches, and Ayurvedic treatments.

name: Lakshadweep
description: A group of beautiful coral islands in the Arabian Sea.

name: Puducherry
description: Known for its French colonial heritage and serene beaches.

name: Tamil Nadu
description: Famous for its Dravidian temples and rich cultural history.

name: Telangana
description: Home to Hyderabad, Charminar, and historical sites.

name: Ahmedabad
description: The largest city of Gujarat, known for its Sabarmati Ashram and rich heritage.

name: Gandhinagar
description: The capital city of Gujarat, famous for Akshardham Temple and green spaces.

name: Surat
description: A major diamond and textile hub, known for its beaches and street food.

name: Vadodara
description: Known for Laxmi Vilas Palace and its cultural heritage.

name: Rajkot
description: A vibrant city with historical significance and bustling markets.

name: Junagadh
description: Home to Gir National Park and ancient historical sites.

name: Dwarka
description: A sacred Hindu pilgrimage site and home to the Dwarkadhish Temple.

name: Somnath
description: Famous for the legendary Somnath Temple and beautiful coastal views.

name: Bhuj
description: The gateway to the Rann of Kutch, rich in history and handicrafts.

name: Kutch
description: Known for the Great Rann of Kutch and vibrant Rann Utsav.

name: Bhavnagar
description: A coastal city known for its historic temples and Palitana Jain temples.

name: Porbandar
description: The birthplace of Mahatma Gandhi, with beautiful beaches.

name: Patan
description: Home to the UNESCO-listed Rani Ki Vav stepwell.

name: Modhera
description: Famous for the Sun Temple, an architectural marvel.

name: Champaner-Pavagadh
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site with historical forts and temples.

name: Saputara
description: The only hill station in Gujarat, known for scenic beauty.

name: Diu
description: A small island with Portuguese heritage, beaches, and forts.

name: Mandvi
description: A coastal town famous for its pristine beaches and Vijay Vilas Palace.

name: Anand
description: The birthplace of the Amul dairy revolution.

name: Dholavira
description: An ancient Harappan Civilization site in the Rann of Kutch.

name: Gateway of India
description: An iconic arch monument built during the 20th century in Mumbai.

name: Marine Drive
description: A beautiful promenade along the Arabian Sea, also known as the Queen?s Necklace.

name: Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site and a historic railway station.

name: Elephanta Caves
description: Ancient rock-cut caves with stunning sculptures dedicated to Lord Shiva.

name: Juhu Beach
description: A popular beach famous for street food and Bollywood celebrity homes.

name: Colaba Causeway
description: A bustling shopping street known for fashion, accessories, and cafes.

name: Haji Ali Dargah
description: A famous mosque and dargah located on an islet in the Arabian Sea.

name: Siddhivinayak Temple
description: A revered temple dedicated to Lord Ganesha.

name: Bandra-Worli Sea Link
description: A modern engineering marvel connecting Bandra and Worli.

name: Film City
description: The heart of Bollywood, where movies and TV shows are filmed.

name: Chowpatty Beach
description: A lively beach famous for Mumbai?s street food and festivals.

name: Sanjay Gandhi National Park
description: A lush green national park home to leopards and ancient Kanheri Caves.

name: Kanheri Caves
description: Ancient Buddhist caves located inside Sanjay Gandhi National Park.

name: Worli Fort
description: A historic fort offering scenic views of the Bandra-Worli Sea Link.

name: Global Vipassana Pagoda
description: A meditation center and Buddhist pagoda offering tranquility.

name: Mani Bhavan
description: A museum dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi?s life and work.

name: Crawford Market
description: A historic market known for fresh produce, pets, and imported goods.

name: Nehru Planetarium
description: A science and space research center with interactive exhibits.

name: Taraporewala Aquarium
description: One of India?s oldest aquariums, housing marine and freshwater species.
